lead_paragraph: A leaked memo reveals strife in the trust that controls the Hershey Company and the school for at-risk children started by its founder, Milton Hershey.

headline.main: Back-Stabbing and Threats of a ‘Suicide Parachute’ at Hershey

snippet: A leaked memo reveals strife in the trust that controls the Hershey Company and the school for at-risk children started by its founder, Milton Hershey....
abstract: Hershey Trust Company, overseers of nonprofit Milton Hershey School for at-risk children, agrees to establish board member term limits and set base compensation as part of deal with Pennsylvania attorney general; agreement, meant to address allegations of self-interest and mismanagement, is criticized by Protect the Hershey’s Children co-founder Frederic Fouad and Pablo Eisenberg, senior fellow at McCourt School of Public Policy at Georgetown, who insist sweeping changes are needed to fix systemic issues that have long plagued trust.
